## PowerPoint to Reveal.js Conversion Pipeline

### Step 1: Convert PPT to Markdown


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Check if PPT file exists
if (!file.exists(ppt_path)) {
  stop(paste("PPT file not found:", ppt_path))
}

# Run pandoc conversion
system(sprintf('pandoc "%s" -o "%s" --extract-media=%s', 
               ppt_path, md_output, media_dir))

cat("Conversion complete!\n")
cat("Output file:", md_output, "\n")
```
:::


### Step 2: Read and Display Converted Content


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Read the converted markdown
if (file.exists(md_output)) {
  converted_content <- readLines(md_output, warn = FALSE)
  cat(paste(converted_content, collapse = "\n"))
} else {
  cat("Markdown file not found. Run Step 1 first.")
}
```
:::


### Step 3: Clean and Structure Content


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Function to clean markdown for Reveal.js
clean_for_revealjs <- function(md_file) {
  lines <- readLines(md_file, warn = FALSE)
  
  # Replace level 1 headers with level 2 (for slides)
  lines <- gsub("^# ", "## ", lines)
  
  # Ensure proper slide breaks
  lines <- gsub("^---$", "\n---\n", lines)
  
  # Fix image paths (if needed)
  lines <- gsub("!\\[\\]\\(ppt/media/", "![](media/", lines)
  
  # Save cleaned version
  cleaned_file <- sub("\\.md$", "_cleaned.md", md_file)
  writeLines(lines, cleaned_file)
  
  cat("Cleaned file saved:", cleaned_file, "\n")
  return(cleaned_file)
}

# Run cleaning
cleaned_md <- clean_for_revealjs(md_output)

# Display cleaned content
cat("\n--- CLEANED CONTENT ---\n\n")
cat(paste(readLines(cleaned_md, warn = FALSE), collapse = "\n"))
```
:::

## Usage Instructions

**For each new lecture:**

1. Update `ppt_filename` in the setup chunk (line 15)
2. Set `eval: true` in the conversion chunks
3. Run the document (Ctrl+Shift+K or click Render)
4. Review the cleaned output
5. Copy and paste content into the "Lecture Content" section below
6. Set `eval: false` again to prevent re-running conversion
7. Adjust formatting as needed

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
